skill.name: fluidsim
skill.description: Framework for computational fluid dynamics simulations using Python. Use when running fluid dynamics simulations including Navier-Stokes equations (2D/3D), shallow water equations, stratified flows, or when analyzing turbulence, vortex dynamics, or geophysical flows. Provides pseudospectral methods with FFT, HPC support, and comprehensive output analysis.
skill.summary: Framework for computational fluid dynamics simulations using Python. Use when running fluid dynamics...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill contains only documentation and usage examples for FluidSim. No file system access, network calls, or execution logic is present. No security risks detected.

content.value_statement: You need clear steps to set up and run CFD simulations. This skill guides solver selection, parameter setup, execution, and analysis.
actual_capabilities: Explain installation options including FFT and MPI extras
Guide parameter configuration for resolution, viscosity, and time stepping
Outline workflows to run 2D and 3D Navier-Stokes simulations
Describe analysis of fields, spectra, and spatial means outputs
Show how to restart from saved state files
limitations: Requires the FluidSim Python package to be installed
Does not provide mesh-based or non-periodic boundary solvers
No built-in visualization beyond documented plotting calls

prompt_templates.title: Quick start
prompt_templates.prompt: Show the minimal steps to run a 2D Navier-Stokes simulation and plot vorticity.

prompt_templates.title: Parameter setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me set grid size, domain length, viscosity, and CFL time stepping for ns2d.

prompt_templates.title: Analysis workflow
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to load a run and analyze spatial means and spectra.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced run
prompt_templates.prompt: Guide me to enable MPI, set tcrandom forcing, and organize output directories.

output_examples.input: I want a 3D turbulence run and basic analysis steps.
output: Set nx, ny, nz and viscosity based on target Reynolds number
Run with optional MPI using mpirun for large grids
Analyze energy spectra and spatial means after completion

best_practices: Use power-of-two grid sizes for FFT performance
Enable CFL-based time stepping for stability
Save spectra and spatial means at sensible intervals
anti_patterns: Running large grids without FFT libraries installed
Using non-existent parameter names that cause AttributeError
Saving every field every time step on large runs

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides guidance and examples that work across these platforms.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It documents FluidSim usage only and does not add new solvers or features.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my cluster workflow?
faq.answer: Yes. It includes MPI and cluster submission patterns for FluidSim.

faq.question: Does it access or send my data?
faq.answer: No. The skill is documentation only and performs no data access.

faq.question: What if my simulation fails to start?
faq.answer: Check FFT and MPI dependencies, then verify parameters and paths.

faq.question: How does it compare to general CFD guides?
faq.answer: It is specific to FluidSim workflows and parameters, not a general CFD tutorial.
